Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.configurations

Class YAMLData

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.configurations.YAMLData
Direct Known Subclasses:
APIData, PageData
public class YAMLData
extends java.lang.Object
The YAMLData class stores common data structures between page and api object yaml files to reduce code duplication.
Author:
dougnoel

  • Method Details

    • loadYaml

      public static YAMLData loadYaml​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Returns YAMLData for the given fileName as a string.
      Parameters:
      fileName - String the name of the page configuration file
      Returns:
      YAMLData the configured YAMLData
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the configuration file cannot be opened or read
      See Also:
      loadYaml(File)

    • loadYaml

      public static YAMLData loadYaml​(java.io.File fileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Returns the usable YAMLData object from the given File object.
      Parameters:
      fileName - File the File object to which the configurations will be mapped.
      Returns:
      YAMLData the configured APIData
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the configuration file cannot be opened or read

    • getAccount

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getAccount​(java.lang.String env, java.lang.String account)
      Returns account data for the given environment and the given account, e.g. If an environment has more than one account, Sentinel can run tests for any number of those accounts.
      Parameters:
      env - String the desired environment (qa, sit, etc.)
      account - String the requested account
      Returns:
      Map<String, String> the user account data, or null if the requested environment doesn't exist

    • getPageParts

      public java.lang.String[] getPageParts()
      Returns any other places we might be including test data from.
      Returns:
      String[] list of page parts

    • containsUrl

      public boolean containsUrl​(java.lang.String env)
      Returns whether or not a URL exists for the given environment in the API object.
      Parameters:
      env - String the environment to check
      Returns:
      boolean true if found, otherwise false

    • getUrl

      public java.lang.String getUrl​(java.lang.String env)
      Returns a URL based on the environment passed.
      Parameters:
      env - String the environment to check
      Returns:
      String the URL

    • getTestdata

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getTestdata​(java.lang.String env, java.lang.String dataObject)
      Returns testdata data for the given environment and the given dataobject (named in the YAML page object).

      Example of test data:

       testdata:
   alpha:
     report:
       id: 123456
       version: 1
      Parameters:
      env - String the desired environment (qa, sit, etc.)
      dataObject - String the requested dataobject
      Returns:
      Map<String, String> the dataobject data, or null if the requested environment doesn't exist

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the YAMLFile
      Returns:
      String the name of the file without the .yml extension
